image.title: World News Today, Trending World News, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: Merriam-Webster declares word of the year: ‘Polarization’
item.description: Merriam-Webster declared "polarization" as its 2024 Word of the Year, reflecting the deep divisions highlighted by the US presidential election. Lookups surged for words like "demure," "fortnight," and "allision" due to viral videos, music, and news events. "Resonate" saw increased usage in AI-generated texts, while "cognitive," "pander," and "democracy" captured political discourse.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Person of interest arrested in connection with UnitedHealthcare CEO shooting
item.description: ​The first arrest in connection with the murder of UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson was made on Monday in Pennsylvania. The man was nabbed while trying to use a fake ID at a McDonald's and was taken into custody by cops in Altoona, about 233 miles west of New York City.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: ‘Volunteer IT Consultant': Elon Musk just picked his own designation for DOGE
item.description: Elon Musk wants to spearhead the Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE) to modernize outdated federal IT systems. Musk highlighted the systems' inability to track taxpayer money effectively, citing a 2019 report revealing significant maintenance costs and security risks. DOGE aims to reduce government waste and improve accountability, with a focus on entitlement program inefficiencies.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Who is Emily Clouse? County Commissioner facing allegations of forcing aide into relationship
item.description: Thurston County Commissioner Emily Clouse faces scrutiny following an investigation into her conduct. While cleared of sexual harassment and retaliation, the investigation confirmed a romantic relationship with her former aide, Allyn Hershey, violating ethical guidelines. Clouse also borrowed money and accepted gifts from Hershey, further breaching ethical standards.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Bizarre conspiracy theory claims Brian Thompson might have hired someone to kill him because...
item.description: Neil Franklin on a CNN panel recently said that he won't be surprised if it's proved that UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson himself hired the killer to murder him. Franklin said such a possibility for insurance, for many other reasons can not be ruled out because the killer had too much information about the exact time Brian Thompson would appear in front of the hotel.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Bad spell': How 'witchcraft' sparked nearly 200 executions in Haiti
item.description: Over 180 people were massacred in Cité Soleil, Haiti, over the weekend, according to the UN. A gang leader allegedly ordered the killings as revenge for his son's death, which he believed was caused by witchcraft. Elderly Vodou practitioners were specifically targeted, with many bodies burned or disposed of at sea. The violence highlights Haiti's escalating gang crisis and dire security situation.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Harris to Musk: The 10 contenders for Time’s Person of the Year 2024
item.description: The announcement of TIME's 2024 Person of the Year is eagerly awaited and will be made on Thursday. This annual tradition, which began in 1927, celebrates individuals, groups, or ideas that have had the greatest influence—positive or negative—on global events over the past year. Last year, the title went to music sensation Taylor Swift. Past recipients include Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky and the “spirit of Ukraine” in 2022, tech entrepreneur Elon Musk in 2021, Ebola fighters in 2014, and former U.S. President Barack Obama in both 2008 and 2012.

item.title: Harris, Trump or Musk? See full list of finalists for TIME’s Person of the Year 2024
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Passenger on Mexico flight tries to hijack and divert plane to US, arrested
item.description: A Volaris flight from León to Tijuana was diverted to Guadalajara after a passenger attempted to hijack the plane. The 31-year-old man, claiming his family was threatened, assaulted a flight attendant and tried to enter the cockpit. He was apprehended by the crew and handed over to authorities upon landing. The flight later continued to its original destination.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Elon Musk's 4-year-old son has this 4-word advice for father in viral video
item.description: "The kid has great instincts," Elon Musk wrote sharing a video of his four-year-old son X AE A-XII giving him some advice. The video went viral as it was the first time X was seen talking. "Barron Trump and Lil X will one day be President and Vice President," one comment to the video said. "DOGE jr for president 2084," another comment said.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: The Don’s Consigliere: Why Trump chose Allina Habba to be Counsellor to President
item.description: Habba’s appointment as Counselor to the President reads like a scene from a mob movie. The Boss—facing a never-ending string of legal indictments, defamation suits, and scandals—needed someone not just with sharp legal skills but with undying loyalty. Enter Habba, who has proven herself time and again to be the kind of consigliere who will go to the mattresses for her Don, whether it’s suing Hillary Clinton for RICO or locking horns with Judge Lewis Kaplan in the E. Jean Carroll defamation case.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Kamala Harris smiling awkwardly in viral video as Bidens ignore: 'They freaking hate her'
item.description: President Joe Biden and vice president Kamala Harris were seen together at the Kennedy Center Honors Sunday but it could not be more awkward with the Bidens ignoring the presence of Kamala Harris and Doug Emhoff in a viral video -- even when they four pose together for the cameras. In the viral video, they did not exchange glances or smiles or pretend to know each other.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Hope rekindled: Syrian refugees return home after Bashar al-Assad’s ouster
MIT 'expels' PhD student Prahlad Iyengar for pro-Palestine essay
item.description: MIT PhD student Prahlad Iyengar has been suspended until 2026 following a pro-Palestine essay published in a student magazine. ​The October issue of the magazine included the article “On Pacifism,” which featured imagery and language that “could be interpreted as a call for more violent or destructive forms of protest at MIT,” according to an email sent by MIT Dean of Student Life David Warren Randall to the editors of the magazine.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Star Wars: How Musk vs Bezos space race could reshape humanity
item.description: Jeff Bezos and Elon Musk are like rival Jedi Masters battling for control of the galaxy's destiny. Bezos, the Obi-Wan Kenobi of space, envisions protecting Earth, the "Chosen One," by moving industries to orbital sanctuaries—akin to peaceful Alderaan. Musk, the bold Luke Skywalker, dreams of leading humanity to Mars, a Tatooine-like refuge, to survive inevitable cataclysms. Their rivalry mirrors a Star Wars saga, from dueling over NASA’s “Death Star” contracts to trading jabs like lightsaber strikes. Whether Bezos’ industrial "Rebel Alliance" or Musk’s Martian "Empire" prevails, their cosmic clash will shape humanity’s next chapter in this galactic epic.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Independence from Assad': How the rebel flag differs from the current Syrian flag
item.description: Syrian jihadist rebels declared victory on Sunday, announcing the capture of Damascus and the end of President Bashar al-Assad's 13-year rule. Assad's ouster marks a major turning point, ending a 50-year dynasty. Celebrations erupted as opposition flags, symbolizing resistance to Assad's regime, replaced his portraits across the nation and in diaspora communities.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Did Trump discuss Harry and Meghan Markle with Prince William?
item.description: Donald Trump asked Prince William about his father King Charles and wife Princess Kate. ​"And I asked him about his wife and he said she’s doing well. And I asked him about his father and his father is fighting very hard, and he loves his father and he loves his wife, so it was sad. We had a great talk for half an hour, a little more than half an hour. We had a great, great talk," Trump said. There was apparently no chat about William's estranged brother Prince Harry, and Meghan Markle.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Trump's jail threat to Jan 6 committee members; Liz Cheney fires back
item.description: President-elect Donald Trump said all members of the Ja 6 committee including Liz Cheney and Bennie Thompson should be jailed as they deleted all the evidence from their investigation. Liz Cheney said, “Donald Trump’s suggestion that members of Congress who later investigated his illegal and unconstitutional actions should be jailed is a continuation of his assault on the rule of law and the foundations of our republic.”
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Why Hawk Tuah girl's Hawkcoin ($HAWK) crashed so soon
item.description: Analysis from platforms like Bubblemaps and Dexscreener revealed that 80% to 90% of Hawkcoin's supply was controlled by a small group of wallets at launch. This uneven distribution made the coin vulnerable to massive sell-offs by these major holders, triggering a rapid devaluation.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Jay-Z accused of raping 13-year-old girl with Diddy: Mapping the journey of 2 hip-hop titans
item.description: Jay-Z faces accusations of raping a minor alongside Sean "Diddy" Combs at a 2000 party. He denies the claims, calling them a blackmail attempt. The allegations threaten to overshadow the hip-hop moguls' long history of collaboration and rivalry, spanning from the 1990s to their shared billionaire status.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
